intro: Cicercula alba, commonly known as the white cicercula, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, hairy stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine pubescence. Cicercula alba is often found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and stream banks.
